Hydrix dragons are high-level Slayer monsters requiring level 101 Slayer to kill. They are part of the gemstone dragon group, and are the strongest dragon of this type.

A total of six hydrix dragons are located in the gemstone cavern under the Shilo Village mine. They require the completion of the hard Karamja achievements in order to access them in the gemstone cavern underneath. In order to pass the barrier to confront them, players are also required to sacrifice a number of uncut dragonstone, uncut onyx, or uncut hydrix gems—with each gem type allowing the player to kill a certain number of dragons within their respective chamber, up to a limit of storing 60,000 kills at a time.

If the player is on a gemstone dragon Slayer task, charges are neither needed nor consumed.

Entrance fee to killing hydrix dragons
Uncut gem Kills per gem Cost per kill
Uncut dragonstone 2 2,522
Uncut onyx 400 2,652
Incomplete hydrix 4,000 15,312

Killing hydrix dragons at either location in the Wilderness does not require any kind of fee whatsoever.

Locations[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Requirements Spawns Map
Gemstone cavern133None6Maplink
Wilderness (level 47) Lava Maze mine133None6Maplink
Deep Wilderness Dungeon133None4Maplink

Getting there[edit | edit source]

The gemstone cavern is located inside the gem mine in the northern-western part of Shilo Village in Karamja. To be able to enter the cave players must have completed the hard Karamja achievements. To access the mine players can teleport directly to the gem mine with the option in the Karamja gloves 3 or 4.

Hydrix dragons can also be found in the Wilderness, near the Lava Maze mine and in the Deep Wilderness Dungeon.

Strategies[edit | edit source]

Hydrix dragons attack primarily with magic, although they will use both magic and melee if within melee range in addition to the regular dragon fire attack.

Hydrix dragons have a special attack in which they send a row of spikes towards the area that the player is currently standing on. After a short delay, there is a three-by-three game square area where spikes appear, dealing magic damage and draining all adrenaline while also applying a debuff where adrenaline gained is reduced to half for 15 seconds. However, they will not use this special attack if the player remains within melee distance of them.

Hydrix dragons have quite high Defence, so players may wish to use accuracy-boosting auras such as maniacal aura or supreme runic accuracy aura as well as a nihil familiar for their combat style to ensure that they have a good accuracy against these dragons.

Devotion in conjunction with Protect or Deflect Magic does block all damage done by the special attack, but it does not block the adrenaline loss nor does it prevent the debuff from occurring. While one may also use Resonance to heal from the attack, due to the debuff still occurring and its crippling nature, one should dodge it instead.

It is possible to kill hydrix dragons with an aggression potion active and while not paying attention to the possible special attacks rather safely by placing a hydrix dragon soul in their own Slayer dungeon and standing on top of the dragon's spawn point. This makes it likely that the dragon targets the player before it gets out of melee distance, and thus prevents it from using its special attacks. Players can also use the Deep Wilderness Dungeon as there are two spawns and cannons can be placed, allowing players to get upwards of 1,000,000 experience per hour in Slayer there.

Wilderness drop table[edit | edit source]

This monster has access to the Wilderness shared loot table, which is a tertiary drop. To access the table, it has to be killed inside the Wilderness.
Luck-enhancing items are not required to access the table, but do increase the chance of doing so, as does doing higher-level content.

Achievement[edit | edit source]

  • Jungle Predator ( 0) – Obtained a collection of unique drops from Slayer monsters located within Karamja.
    • Gemstone hauberk drop

Update history[edit | edit source]

This information has been compiled as part of the update history project. Some updates may not be included – see here for how to help out!
  • patch 20 November 2017 (Update):
    • Players who have not read some post-quest dialogue after Shilo Village can now attack Hydrix dragons in the Sunken Pyramid.
  • update 3 April 2017 (Update):
    • Added to game.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • It was the first monster to have a static Slayer level requirement above 99.
  • Upon release, the highest possible Slayer level was still 99, thus meaning one would've needed to utilise boosts to be allowed to kill them no matter what level they were. Wilder pies were released alongside the gemstone dragon update to ensure players could get consistent kills without having to reboost.
  • The experience rates were buffed a few months after release due to player complaints.

References[edit | edit source]

    Onyx dragons drop: Legs or Helm (50/50)
    Hydrix dragons drop: Body only"
  2. ^ Mod Timbo. "Dev Blog: Revealing Drop Rates." 1 December 2017. (Archived from the original on 17 June 2020.) Existing Game Updates Forums.
